sentence.Network_en: Police with riot gear and several fire engines are in attendance.
sentence.Network_cn: 防暴警察和数辆消防车都到了。

sentence.Network_en: He would have a nurse in constant attendance day and night.
sentence.Network_cn: 会有一位护士日夜不间断地陪护着他。

sentence.Network_en: Average weekly cinema attendance in February was 2.41 million.
sentence.Network_cn: 2月份，平均每周的观影人数为241万。

jx.jx_en_mean: present at a function or a place
accompanying a member of royalty or other important person as an assistant or servant
jx.jx_cn_mean: （作为助手或仆人）随同（皇室成员或要人）

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Old French, from atendre 'give one's attention to' (see attend)

entry.def: Someone's attendance at an event or an institution is the fact that they are present at the event or go regularly to the institution.

example.ex: Her attendance at school was sporadic.

entry.def: The attendance at an event is the number of people who are present at it.

example.ex: Average weekly cinema attendance in February was 2.41 million...
example.tran: 2月份，平均每周的观影人数为241万。

example.ex: This year attendances were 28% lower than forecast...
example.tran: 今年的出席人数比预期少28%。

entry.def: If someone is in attendance at a place or an event, they are there.

example.ex: Councillor Paul Tisley will be in attendance at the start of the meeting to welcome us...
example.tran: 议员保罗·提斯里将在会议开始时出席，以欢迎我们。

example.ex: Police with riot gear and several fire engines are in attendance.
example.tran: 防暴警察和数辆消防车都到了。

entry.def: If someone is in attendance on an important person, they are accompanying that person as a servant or assistant.

example.ex: He lived in considerable style, travelling widely, usually with a cook, valet, butler and chauffeur in attendance.
example.tran: 他活得相当潇洒，通常带着厨师、用人、管家和司机到处游玩。

means.word_mean: 1. the act of being present (at a meeting or event etc.)

auth_sentence.content: I expect that attendance will fall among the justies.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I expect that attendance will fall among the justies.

auth_sentence.content: Their attendance or lack thereof has been controversial recently.
auth_sentence.res_content: Their attendance or lack thereof has been controversial recently.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Their attendance or lack thereof has been controversial recently.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的
stems_affixes.word_buile: intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图

stems_affixes.value_cn: 嫩的, 温柔的, 软弱的
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向+er→像伸出的幼芽→嫩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
stems_affixes.word_buile: attend[v.出席,参加]+ance表名词→n.出席, 出席的人数, 伺候, 照料
attend[v.出席,参加]+ant人→n.服务员;随从,随员
intend[v.想要,打算,企图]+ed……的→adj.有意的, 故意的, 已经订婚的 n.已经订婚者
intend[[v.想要,打算,企图]]拿省鷄dj.目不转睛的,热切的 n.意图
tend趋向+ency表名词→n.趋势,趋向;倾向
at加强+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→出席
con一起+tend伸展,趋向→一起伸展→竞争,斗争

stems_affixes.value_cn: 延长,延伸;扩充;给予;提供;估价
stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+tend伸展,趋向→伸出去→扩张
in内+tend伸展,趋向→内心伸出→想要

stems_affixes.value_cn: 假装,假托,借口,[在演戏中]装扮
stems_affixes.word_buile: pre预先,提前+tend伸展,趋向→提前展开,事先展开→假装,借口
pro前+tend伸展,趋向→v.[使]伸出, [使]伸展

stems_affixes.value_cn: 趋向,往往是;易于,往往会;照料,看护
stems_affixes.word_buile: tend伸展,趋向→趋向做→易于,往往会

means.word_mean: 出席次数;出席；参加；上学；到场

sentences.en: He missed three attendances this year.
The attendance of this class never dropped off.
sentences.cn: 这个班的出席人数从未下降。

jushi.english: The attendance of this class never dropped off.
jushi.chinese: 这个班的出席人数从未下降。

jushi.english: The attendance of meetings takes up a great deal of my time.
jushi.chinese: 参加各种会议占去我很多时间。

jushi.english: He missed three attendances this year.
